name: Detect Illusion
effect: For one hour after casting the spell, you psychically discern the presence of illusions.

name: Fleeting Illusion
effect: You manifest a small illusion, which may have a physical and auditory component. The illusion may be used to lure, mystify, repel, or even assist the target. However, if the target passes a DT 16 {{skills.perception}} check, they are able to perceive the illusion.

name: Illusory Disguise
effect: For one hour, your face appears to change to match any face you have seen previously. Your clothes, stature, and body type do not change unless you also know the {{spells.illusory_being}} spell. You may dismiss this spell at will before the duration is through. Anyone who scrutinizes your face may make a DT 18 {{skills.perception}} check to see past your disguise.

name: Dispell Illusion
effect: An illusion spell you have detected is permanently dispelled. Some illusions may make a saving throw based on the charisma of the caster.

name: Illusory Being
effect: You create an illusory being of any of the following types: Beguiling, Terrifying, Distracting, or Ordinary. The being appears in a location you can see, and obeys your telepathic command for the duration of the spell.

name: Fool's Invisibility
effect: The target is filled with the inexplicable and illogical conviction that they are fully invisible.
